title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) is not being rejected correctly when stored in the report design.
OB: When a user enters an invalid date string in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid date string is not being rejected.
EB: The invalid date string '55/66/9999' should be rejected and not stored as the default value for the 'DateTime' report parameter.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Save the report design.
5. Open the report design again and check if the invalid date string is stored as the default value for the report parameter.
